errors.error_description: The example ELASTICSEARCH_URL is missing the required 'http://' protocol prefix. This will cause the application to fail when trying to connect to Elasticsearch.
correction_candidates: Add the 'http://' protocol prefix to the ELASTICSEARCH_URL value.
Change the URL to 'localhost:9200' and configure credentials in local.py.
Use 'https://' if Elasticsearch is configured with TLS/SSL.
Remove the user and password from the URL and set them in a different environment variable.
errors.golden_answer: Add the 'http://' protocol prefix to the ELASTICSEARCH_URL value.

errors.error_description: The setup instructions incorrectly place the 'loaddata' command before the 'migrate' command. Data cannot be loaded into database tables that have not yet been created by running migrations.
correction_candidates: Run 'python manage.py migrate' before 'python manage.py loaddata'.
Combine the commands into a single line: 'python manage.py migrate && python manage.py loaddata ...'.
Use the '--database' flag with 'loaddata' to specify the target database.
errors.golden_answer: Run 'python manage.py migrate' before 'python manage.py loaddata'.
